channel.title: Help wit accurate mage xp?
channel.description: I'm using the figment scape source mainly because its a good source. I'm trying to make the xp as it is in runescape for mage spells and i cant it seems to times what ever u hit by 1000 can anyone help me with this...ive change how much it gives u for and xp rate but..still adds 1k xp per number hit. Confused

item.title: Help wit accurate mage xp?
item.dc:creator: @tonypker13 tonypker13
item.description:
@tonypker13 wrote:

Actually, to do mage it would beunder the regular combat ones.
Heres the regular ones.

inCombat(); if (FightType == 1) // Accurate { TotalExp = (double) (70 * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerAttack); } else if (FightType == 2) // Agressive { TotalExp = (double) (70 * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerStrength); } else if (FightType == 4) // Defensive { TotalExp = (double) (70 * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerDefence); } else if (FightType == 3) // Controlled { TotalExp = (double) (70 * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerStrength); } TotalExp = (double) (2000 * hitDiff); TotalExp = (double) (TotalExp * CombatExpRate); addSkillXP((int) (TotalExp), playerHitpoints); actionTimer = 7;

Mage would more likely be like this.

castOnPlayer.inCombat(); addSkillXP((XP here+playerLevel[6]), 6); inCombat(); PkingDelay = 10; teleportToX = absX; teleportToY = absY; } else if(playerLevel[6] <= Lvl) { sendMessage("You need a magic level of (lvl) to cast this spell."); }

Read full topic
